meanings.definition: To not cook or heat food
meanings.sent1: I will uncook the vegetables by not putting them in the oven.
meanings.sent2: She decided to uncook the pasta and eat it cold instead.
meanings.sent3: He tried to uncook the burnt toast, but it was beyond repair.
meanings.sent4: The chef had to uncook the overcooked steak to salvage the meal.
meanings.sent5: Uncooking the soup made it taste fresher and more natural.

meanings.sent1: After realizing the mistake, she had to uncook the eggs to start over.
meanings.sent2: The recipe required her to uncook the sauce before adding the final ingredients.
meanings.sent3: Trying to uncook the cake batter was a messy but necessary task.
meanings.sent4: He had to uncook the stew to adjust the seasoning properly.
meanings.sent5: Uncooking the caramel was tricky, but she managed to do it successfully.

meanings.definition: To prepare food without applying heat
meanings.sent1: She learned how to uncook a delicious salad with fresh ingredients.
meanings.sent2: The chef's specialty was to uncook sushi rolls with precision and creativity.
meanings.sent3: Uncooking the fruit salad made it a refreshing and healthy snack.
meanings.sent4: He decided to uncook the meal to maintain its raw and natural flavors.
meanings.sent5: Uncooking the dish required a different set of skills but was equally satisfying.
